titleInfo.title: 27HS1 Slayden Site 3HS1, Humphreys County, Tennessee. Mound 3. Feature 14, rectangular ceremonial house pattern

mods.abstract: [Feature 14] A rectangular structure oriented with the long axis North and South. At the North end is a double wall, the outside wall of which extends eastward and under Feature 23 to stake 15.8. From the datum readings it would appear that the structure is on a lower level than the circular one (Feature 23). The east side of this structure is 1.5' beneath the surface, however the west side is only a few tenths of a foot below. This is probably due to the fact that this side is on the west slope of the mound (natural rise) and the plow has dragged the soil away thus leaving the West wall near the surface. [Feature 15] A small fire bed of red baked clay hollowed out in the center into a basin shape. It was filled with charcoal. This fire basin is associated with structure 14 and is in the SE corner. [Feature 16] A square firebed, 1' below surface, hollowed out into a basin shape and was filled with charcoal. This seems to have been the main fire bed in structure 14, and was fairly close to the center.
mods.note: More narrative and illustrations available on file. See also photographs 14HS1 [fhm00946], 15HS1 [fhm00947], and 16HS1 [fhm00948],
